abstract.p: New York Islanders will begin regular season without defenseman Eric Cairns, who is out for at least four weeks with fractured left wrist (S)

block.p: The Islanders will begin the regular season Friday without defenseman Eric Cairns, who is out for at least four weeks with a fractured left wrist.

Cairns, who last season blossomed into one of the mainstays of the young Islander defense, sustained the injury in Sunday's 2-1 exhibition loss to the Rangers when he was checked into the boards by Vladimir Malakov in the second period.
The Islanders will begin the regular season Friday without defenseman Eric Cairns, who is out for at least four weeks with a fractured left wrist.

Cairns, who last season blossomed into one of the mainstays of the young Islander defense, sustained the injury in Sunday's 2-1 exhibition loss to the Rangers when he was checked into the boards by Vladimir Malakov in the second period.

Cairns, who led the Islanders in penalty minutes with 196 last season -- fifth in the National Hockey League -- had been paired with the veteran Garry Galley through training camp. The Islanders had been carrying eight defensemen, with Aris Brimanis and Yevgeny Korolev making up the final two spots.
